title: J. P. Foschi
text:
John Paul Marino "J. P." Foschi (pronounced FAH-shee) (born May 19, 1982 in <a href="Queens%2C%20New%20York">Queens, New York</a>) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="tight%20end">tight end</a>. He was signed by the <a href="New%20York%20Jets">New York Jets</a> as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> in 2004. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Georgia%20Tech%20Yellow%20Jackets%20football">Georgia Tech</a>.
Foschi has also been a member of the <a href="Denver%20Broncos">Denver Broncos</a>, <a href="Minnesota%20Vikings">Minnesota Vikings</a>, <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a>, <a href="Kansas%20City%20Chiefs">Kansas City Chiefs</a>, and <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a>.
Early years.
Foschi is from <a href="Long%20Island">Long Island</a>, <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>. He attended Friends Academy Middle School in Locust Valley, NY and <a href="Chaminade%20High%20School">Chaminade High School</a>. in <a href="Mineola%2C%20New%20York">Mineola, New York</a> and was a four-year <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>.
Personal life.
John Paul is the son of Margaret and Robert Foschi. His father graduated from <a href="Columbia%20University">Columbia University</a> in 1976 where he played <a href="basketball">basketball</a> and studied <a href="engineering">engineering</a>. J. P. has two sisters who were <a href="Division%20I%20%28NCAA%29">Division I</a> college <a href="Swimming%20%28sport%29">swimmers</a>.
